content: These include comments related to our financial results; trends and guidance for the fourth quarter and full year 2022 and 2023; the impact of macroeconomic changes; the benefits of our platform, industry and market trends; our go-to-market and growth strategy; our market opportunity and ability to expand our leadership position; our ability to maintain and upsell existing customers; and our ability to acquire new customers. In the third quarter of 2022, Appianâs cloud subscription revenue grew 30% year-over-year to $60.6 million. Cloud subscription revenue was $60.6 million, an increase of 30% year-over-year and absorbed another 1% of incremental FX headwinds since we gave guidance on August 4. Total subscriptions revenue was $86.5 million, an increase of 29% year-over-year. Professional services revenue was $31.4 million, an increase of 25% year-over-year. Total revenue was $117.9 million, an increase of 28% year-over-year and above our guidance range. Total deferred revenue was $164.6 million as of September 30, 2022, an increase of 32% from the year period. For the fourth quarter of 2022, cloud subscription revenue is expected to be between $63.5 million and $64.5 million, representing year-over-year growth of 24% and 26%. For the full year 2022, cloud subscription revenue is expected to be between $235 million and $236 million representing year-over-year growth of 31% or 32%. For the full year 2022, total revenue is expected to be between $461 million and $466 million representing year-over-year growth of 25% and 26%. Your line is open. Your line is open.
